CVE-2023-50738
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-18T00:31:53

2 posts

AÂ new feature to prevent Firmware downgrades was recently added to some Lexmark products. A method to override this downgrade protection has been identified.

cR0w at 2025-01-17T22:06:25.375Z ##

This is fun. Lexmark published this advisory on 29 March 2024 with about eight pages of impacted models:

A firmware downgrade prevention vulnerability has been identified in newer Lexmark devices.

sev:LOW 4.3 CVSS:3.1/AV:A/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L

https://publications.lexmark.com/publications/security-alerts/CVE-2023-50738.pdf

But the CVE was published today and it lists it as a perfect 10:

sev:CRIT 10.0 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50738

Makes me wonder about some of the other advisories they currently list but I'm too distracted to dig into those right now so happy hacking: https://www.lexmark.com/en_us/solutions/security/lexmark-security-advisories.html

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T22:06:25.000Z ##

This is fun. Lexmark published this advisory on 29 March 2024 with about eight pages of impacted models:

A firmware downgrade prevention vulnerability has been identified in newer Lexmark devices.

sev:LOW 4.3 CVSS:3.1/AV:A/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L

https://publications.lexmark.com/publications/security-alerts/CVE-2023-50738.pdf

But the CVE was published today and it lists it as a perfect 10:

sev:CRIT 10.0 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50738

Makes me wonder about some of the other advisories they currently list but I'm too distracted to dig into those right now so happy hacking: https://www.lexmark.com/en_us/solutions/security/lexmark-security-advisories.html

CVE-2025-0541
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-18T00:30:59

2 posts

A vulnerability was found in Codezips Gym Management System 1.0 and classified as critical. This issue affects some unknown processing of the file /dashboard/admin/edit_member.php. The manipulation of the argument name leads to sql injection. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Other parameters might be affected as well.

updated 2025-01-17T21:31:51

The manipulation of the argument pgedetails leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2025-21185
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-17T21:31:50

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T19:32:10.646Z ##

Microsoft security advisories 17 January 2025:

  • CVE-2025-21185 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21399 (7.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Update Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. For convenience I won't list out the 13 other patched vulnerabilities from CVE-2025-0434 through 0448 (skipped 0444-0445) that were first announced by Google Chrome on 14 January 2025.

#microsoft #edge #chrome #chromium #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2025-23061
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-17T18:02:41

10 posts

Mongoose versions prior to 8.9.5, 7.8.4, and 6.13.6 are vulnerable to improper use of the `$where` operator. This vulnerability arises from the ability of the `$where` clause to execute arbitrary JavaScript code in MongoDB queries, potentially leading to code injection attacks and unauthorized access or manipulation of database data. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-20

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T07:09:27.000Z ##

CVE-2025-23061 â Mongoose Search Injection Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-23061 Published : Jan. 15, 2025, 5:15 a.m. | 1 hour, 53 minutes ago Description : Mongoose before 8.9.5 can improperly use a nested $where filter with a populate() match, leading to search injection. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2024-53900. Severity: 9.0 | CRITICAL Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected products, timeline, and more... Go to Source

CVE-2025-23201
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-17T15:52:41

4 posts

XSS on the parameters:`/addhost` -> param: community of Librenms versions 24.10.1 ([https://github.com/librenms/librenms](https://github.com/librenms/librenms)) allows remote attackers to inject malicious scripts. When a user views or interacts with the page displaying the data, the malicious script executes immediately, leading to potential unauthorized actions or data exposure. **Proof of Co

CVE-2025-22907 â Citrix RE11S Stack Overflow Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-22907

(4.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-17T15:52:30

4 posts

CVE-2025-22907 â Citrix RE11S Stack Overflow Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-22907

Published : Jan. 16, 2025, 3:15 a.m. | 1 day, 2 hours ago

Description : RE11S v1.11 was discovered to contain a stack overflow via the selSSID parameter in the formWlSiteSurvey function.

Severity: 9.8 | CRITICAL

Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected products, timeline, and moreâ¦

CVE-2024-57892(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-17T15:33:35

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ocfs2: fix slab-use-after-free due to dangling pointer dqi_priv When mounting ocfs2 and then remounting it as read-only, a slab-use-after-free occurs after the user uses a syscall to quota_getnextquota. Specifically, sb_dqinfo(sb, type)->dqi_priv is the dangling pointer. During the remounting process, the pointer dqi_priv is f

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T14:17:27.000Z ##

CVE-2024-57892 â Linux Kernel Ocfs2 Slab-Use-After-Free Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2024-57892 Published : Jan. 15, 2025, 1:15 p.m. | 1 hour, 2 minutes ago Description : In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ocfs2: fix slab-use-after-free due to dangling pointer dqi_priv When mounting ocfs2 and then remounting it as read-only, a slab-use-after-free occurs after the user uses a syscall to quota_getnextquota. Specifically, sb_dqinfo(sb, type)->dqi_priv is the dangling pointer. During the remounting process, the pointer [â¦]

CVE-2024-12142
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-17T12:30:45

2 posts

CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability exists that could cause information disclosure of restricted web page, modification of web page and denial of service when specific web pages are modified and restricted functions are invoked.

cR0w at 2025-01-17T13:41:50.714Z ##

CVEs got published for Schneider Electric's Patch Tuesday advisories. Of course their advisories are in PDFs. ð

CVE-2024-11139 sev:MED 4.6 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:L/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody software.

The EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody is used to enter or import the single line diagram, to get the extensive bill of material of your switchboard, including all devices, connection items, and mounting components

Failure to apply the remediations and mitigations provided below may risk memory corruption, heap-based
buffer overflow, stack-based buffer overflow, which could result in local attackers being able to exploit these issues to potentially execute arbitrary code.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-09&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-09.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11139

CVE-2024-11425 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Modicon M580 PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), BMENOR2200H and EVLink Pro AC products.

Modicon M580 PLCs control and monitor industrial operations.
BMENOR2200H is an advanced RTU communication module for Modicon M580 PLCs.
EVLink Pro AC is a 3rd generation of AC charging station.
Failure to apply the fix or mitigations provided below may risk buffer overflow attack, which could result in Denial-of-Service.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-01&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-01.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11425

CVE-2024-12399 sev:MED 6.1 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:H/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:L/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its Pro-face GP-Pro EX and Remote HMI products.
The Pro-face GP-Pro EX product is HMI Screen Editor & Logic Programming Software.
The Pro-face Remote HMI product is a remote monitoring software for mobile and allows you to check equipment information on a tablet or smartphone.
Failure to apply the mitigations provided below may risk Man-in-the-Middle attacks which could result in information disclosure, integrity issues and operational failures.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-02&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-02.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12399

CVE-2024-12476 sev:HIGH 8.4 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Designer configuration tool for the following Modicon communication modules:
â¢ BMXNOR0200H
â¢ BMXNOE0110(H)
â¢ BMENOC0311(C)
â¢ BMENOC0321(C)
The Web Designer product is a software application used to create Web-based operator panels and configure operating parameters for Web human machine interface (Web HMI) devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk XML external entity attack, which could result in information disclosure, workstation integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised computer.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-04&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-04.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12476

CVE-2024-12142 sev:HIGH 8.8 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:L/VI:L/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Server on Modicon M340 and BMXNOE0100/0110, BMXNOR0200H communication modules products.
The Modicon M340 is a programmable automation controller; BMXNOE0100 and BMXNOE0110 are network communication modules used with Modicon M340. BMXNOR0200H is a communication module that enables M580 and M340 platforms to use RTU protocol exchange with RTU stations.
Failure to apply the remediation/mitigations provided below may risk information disclosure on web pages, modification of web pages and denial of serviceClick or tap here to enter text., which could result in the unavailability of the controllers or modules.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-05&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-05.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12142

2024-12703 sev:HIGH 8.5 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities software product.
The RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities product is a configuration software providing a user interface that allows users to configure and manage communications and operations for SCADAPackTM x70 devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk deserialization of untrusted data, which could result in loss of confidentiality, integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised workstation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-06&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-06.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12703

CVE-2024-10497 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N
and
CVE-2024-10498 sev:MED 6.9 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its PowerLogicâ¢ HDPM6000 High-Density Metering System product.
The HDPM6000 products are high-density, multi-circuit busway and panelboard power meters for cost and network management in large and critical power applications.
Failure to apply the remediation provided below may risk a low privileged user gaining higher level access, which could allow for modification of system configuration parameters or an unauthenticated user causing data corruption or denial of service to the devices web interface via a specially crafted Modbus protocol write operation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-08&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-08.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10497
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10498

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T13:41:50.000Z ##

CVEs got published for Schneider Electric's Patch Tuesday advisories. Of course their advisories are in PDFs. ð

CVE-2024-11139 sev:MED 4.6 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:L/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody software.

The EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody is used to enter or import the single line diagram, to get the extensive bill of material of your switchboard, including all devices, connection items, and mounting components

Failure to apply the remediations and mitigations provided below may risk memory corruption, heap-based
buffer overflow, stack-based buffer overflow, which could result in local attackers being able to exploit these issues to potentially execute arbitrary code.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-09&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-09.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11139

CVE-2024-11425 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Modicon M580 PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), BMENOR2200H and EVLink Pro AC products.

Modicon M580 PLCs control and monitor industrial operations.
BMENOR2200H is an advanced RTU communication module for Modicon M580 PLCs.
EVLink Pro AC is a 3rd generation of AC charging station.
Failure to apply the fix or mitigations provided below may risk buffer overflow attack, which could result in Denial-of-Service.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-01&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-01.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11425

CVE-2024-12399 sev:MED 6.1 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:H/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:L/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its Pro-face GP-Pro EX and Remote HMI products.
The Pro-face GP-Pro EX product is HMI Screen Editor & Logic Programming Software.
The Pro-face Remote HMI product is a remote monitoring software for mobile and allows you to check equipment information on a tablet or smartphone.
Failure to apply the mitigations provided below may risk Man-in-the-Middle attacks which could result in information disclosure, integrity issues and operational failures.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-02&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-02.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12399

CVE-2024-12476 sev:HIGH 8.4 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Designer configuration tool for the following Modicon communication modules:
â¢ BMXNOR0200H
â¢ BMXNOE0110(H)
â¢ BMENOC0311(C)
â¢ BMENOC0321(C)
The Web Designer product is a software application used to create Web-based operator panels and configure operating parameters for Web human machine interface (Web HMI) devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk XML external entity attack, which could result in information disclosure, workstation integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised computer.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-04&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-04.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12476

CVE-2024-12142 sev:HIGH 8.8 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:L/VI:L/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Server on Modicon M340 and BMXNOE0100/0110, BMXNOR0200H communication modules products.
The Modicon M340 is a programmable automation controller; BMXNOE0100 and BMXNOE0110 are network communication modules used with Modicon M340. BMXNOR0200H is a communication module that enables M580 and M340 platforms to use RTU protocol exchange with RTU stations.
Failure to apply the remediation/mitigations provided below may risk information disclosure on web pages, modification of web pages and denial of serviceClick or tap here to enter text., which could result in the unavailability of the controllers or modules.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-05&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-05.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12142

2024-12703 sev:HIGH 8.5 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities software product.
The RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities product is a configuration software providing a user interface that allows users to configure and manage communications and operations for SCADAPackTM x70 devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk deserialization of untrusted data, which could result in loss of confidentiality, integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised workstation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-06&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-06.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12703

CVE-2024-10497 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N
and
CVE-2024-10498 sev:MED 6.9 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its PowerLogicâ¢ HDPM6000 High-Density Metering System product.
The HDPM6000 products are high-density, multi-circuit busway and panelboard power meters for cost and network management in large and critical power applications.
Failure to apply the remediation provided below may risk a low privileged user gaining higher level access, which could allow for modification of system configuration parameters or an unauthenticated user causing data corruption or denial of service to the devices web interface via a specially crafted Modbus protocol write operation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-08&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-08.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10497
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10498

##

CVE-2024-10497
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-17T12:30:45

2 posts

CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key vulnerability exists that could allow an authorized attacker to modify values outside those defined by their privileges (Elevation of Privileges) when the attacker sends modified HTTPS requests to the device.

The Modicon M340 is a programmable automation controller; BMXNOE0100 and BMXNOE0110 are network communication modules used with Modicon M340. BMXNOR0200H is a communication module that enables M580 and M340 platforms to use RTU protocol exchange with RTU stations.

##

CVE-2024-12399
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-17T12:30:44

2 posts

CWE-924: Improper Enforcement of Message Integrity During Transmission in a Communication Channel vulnerability exists that could cause partial loss of confidentiality, loss of integrity and availability of the HMI when attacker performs man in the middle attack by intercepting the communication.

2024-12703 sev:HIGH 8.5 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities software product.
The RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities product is a configuration software providing a user interface that allows users to configure and manage communications and operations for SCADAPackTM x70 devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk deserialization of untrusted data, which could result in loss of confidentiality, integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised workstation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-06&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-06.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12703

CVE-2024-10497 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N
and
CVE-2024-10498 sev:MED 6.9 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its PowerLogicâ¢ HDPM6000 High-Density Metering System product.
The HDPM6000 products are high-density, multi-circuit busway and panelboard power meters for cost and network management in large and critical power applications.
Failure to apply the remediation provided below may risk a low privileged user gaining higher level access, which could allow for modification of system configuration parameters or an unauthenticated user causing data corruption or denial of service to the devices web interface via a specially crafted Modbus protocol write operation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-08&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-08.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10497
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10498

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T13:41:50.000Z ##

CVEs got published for Schneider Electric's Patch Tuesday advisories. Of course their advisories are in PDFs. ð

CVE-2024-11139 sev:MED 4.6 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:L/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody software.

The EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody is used to enter or import the single line diagram, to get the extensive bill of material of your switchboard, including all devices, connection items, and mounting components

Failure to apply the remediations and mitigations provided below may risk memory corruption, heap-based
buffer overflow, stack-based buffer overflow, which could result in local attackers being able to exploit these issues to potentially execute arbitrary code.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-09&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-09.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11139

CVE-2024-11425 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Modicon M580 PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), BMENOR2200H and EVLink Pro AC products.

Modicon M580 PLCs control and monitor industrial operations.
BMENOR2200H is an advanced RTU communication module for Modicon M580 PLCs.
EVLink Pro AC is a 3rd generation of AC charging station.
Failure to apply the fix or mitigations provided below may risk buffer overflow attack, which could result in Denial-of-Service.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-01&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-01.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11425

CVE-2024-12399 sev:MED 6.1 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:H/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:L/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its Pro-face GP-Pro EX and Remote HMI products.
The Pro-face GP-Pro EX product is HMI Screen Editor & Logic Programming Software.
The Pro-face Remote HMI product is a remote monitoring software for mobile and allows you to check equipment information on a tablet or smartphone.
Failure to apply the mitigations provided below may risk Man-in-the-Middle attacks which could result in information disclosure, integrity issues and operational failures.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-02&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-02.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12399

CVE-2024-12476 sev:HIGH 8.4 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Designer configuration tool for the following Modicon communication modules:
â¢ BMXNOR0200H
â¢ BMXNOE0110(H)
â¢ BMENOC0311(C)
â¢ BMENOC0321(C)
The Web Designer product is a software application used to create Web-based operator panels and configure operating parameters for Web human machine interface (Web HMI) devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk XML external entity attack, which could result in information disclosure, workstation integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised computer.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-04&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-04.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12476

CVE-2024-12142 sev:HIGH 8.8 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:L/VI:L/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Server on Modicon M340 and BMXNOE0100/0110, BMXNOR0200H communication modules products.
The Modicon M340 is a programmable automation controller; BMXNOE0100 and BMXNOE0110 are network communication modules used with Modicon M340. BMXNOR0200H is a communication module that enables M580 and M340 platforms to use RTU protocol exchange with RTU stations.
Failure to apply the remediation/mitigations provided below may risk information disclosure on web pages, modification of web pages and denial of serviceClick or tap here to enter text., which could result in the unavailability of the controllers or modules.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-05&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-05.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12142

##

CVE-2024-10498
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-17T11:15:08.340000

2 posts

CWE-119: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer vulnerability exists that could allow an unauthorized attacker to modify configuration values outside of the normal range when the attacker sends specific Modbus write packets to the device which could result in invalid data or loss of web interface functionality.

CVE-2024-12476
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-17T10:15:07.013000

2 posts

CWE-611: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference vulnerability exists that could cause information disclosure, impacts workstation integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised computer, when specific crafted XML file is imported in the Web Designer configuration tool.

CVE-2024-12399 sev:MED 6.1 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:H/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:L/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its Pro-face GP-Pro EX and Remote HMI products.
The Pro-face GP-Pro EX product is HMI Screen Editor & Logic Programming Software.
The Pro-face Remote HMI product is a remote monitoring software for mobile and allows you to check equipment information on a tablet or smartphone.
Failure to apply the mitigations provided below may risk Man-in-the-Middle attacks which could result in information disclosure, integrity issues and operational failures.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-02&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-02.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12399

CVE-2024-12476 sev:HIGH 8.4 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Designer configuration tool for the following Modicon communication modules:
â¢ BMXNOR0200H
â¢ BMXNOE0110(H)
â¢ BMENOC0311(C)
â¢ BMENOC0321(C)
The Web Designer product is a software application used to create Web-based operator panels and configure operating parameters for Web human machine interface (Web HMI) devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk XML external entity attack, which could result in information disclosure, workstation integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised computer.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-04&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-04.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12476

CVE-2024-12142 sev:HIGH 8.8 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:L/VI:L/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Server on Modicon M340 and BMXNOE0100/0110, BMXNOR0200H communication modules products.
The Modicon M340 is a programmable automation controller; BMXNOE0100 and BMXNOE0110 are network communication modules used with Modicon M340. BMXNOR0200H is a communication module that enables M580 and M340 platforms to use RTU protocol exchange with RTU stations.
Failure to apply the remediation/mitigations provided below may risk information disclosure on web pages, modification of web pages and denial of serviceClick or tap here to enter text., which could result in the unavailability of the controllers or modules.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-05&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-05.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12142

2024-12703 sev:HIGH 8.5 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities software product.
The RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities product is a configuration software providing a user interface that allows users to configure and manage communications and operations for SCADAPackTM x70 devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk deserialization of untrusted data, which could result in loss of confidentiality, integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised workstation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-06&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-06.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12703

CVE-2024-10497 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N
and
CVE-2024-10498 sev:MED 6.9 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its PowerLogicâ¢ HDPM6000 High-Density Metering System product.
The HDPM6000 products are high-density, multi-circuit busway and panelboard power meters for cost and network management in large and critical power applications.
Failure to apply the remediation provided below may risk a low privileged user gaining higher level access, which could allow for modification of system configuration parameters or an unauthenticated user causing data corruption or denial of service to the devices web interface via a specially crafted Modbus protocol write operation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-08&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-08.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10497
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10498

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T13:41:50.000Z ##

CVEs got published for Schneider Electric's Patch Tuesday advisories. Of course their advisories are in PDFs. ð

CVE-2024-11139 sev:MED 4.6 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:L/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody software.

The EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody is used to enter or import the single line diagram, to get the extensive bill of material of your switchboard, including all devices, connection items, and mounting components

Failure to apply the remediations and mitigations provided below may risk memory corruption, heap-based
buffer overflow, stack-based buffer overflow, which could result in local attackers being able to exploit these issues to potentially execute arbitrary code.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-09&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-09.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11139

CVE-2024-11425 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Modicon M580 PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), BMENOR2200H and EVLink Pro AC products.

Modicon M580 PLCs control and monitor industrial operations.
BMENOR2200H is an advanced RTU communication module for Modicon M580 PLCs.
EVLink Pro AC is a 3rd generation of AC charging station.
Failure to apply the fix or mitigations provided below may risk buffer overflow attack, which could result in Denial-of-Service.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-01&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-01.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11425

The Pro-face GP-Pro EX product is HMI Screen Editor & Logic Programming Software.
The Pro-face Remote HMI product is a remote monitoring software for mobile and allows you to check equipment information on a tablet or smartphone.
Failure to apply the mitigations provided below may risk Man-in-the-Middle attacks which could result in information disclosure, integrity issues and operational failures.

##

CVE-2024-11425
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-17T09:30:47

2 posts

CWE-131: Incorrect Calculation of Buffer Size vulnerability exists that could cause Denial-of-Service of the product when an unauthenticated user is sending a crafted HTTPS packet to the webserver.

cR0w at 2025-01-17T13:41:50.714Z ##

CVEs got published for Schneider Electric's Patch Tuesday advisories. Of course their advisories are in PDFs. ð

CVE-2024-11139 sev:MED 4.6 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:L/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody software.

The EcoStruxureâ¢ Power Build Rapsody is used to enter or import the single line diagram, to get the extensive bill of material of your switchboard, including all devices, connection items, and mounting components

Failure to apply the remediations and mitigations provided below may risk memory corruption, heap-based
buffer overflow, stack-based buffer overflow, which could result in local attackers being able to exploit these issues to potentially execute arbitrary code.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-09&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-09.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11139

CVE-2024-11425 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Modicon M580 PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), BMENOR2200H and EVLink Pro AC products.

Modicon M580 PLCs control and monitor industrial operations.
BMENOR2200H is an advanced RTU communication module for Modicon M580 PLCs.
EVLink Pro AC is a 3rd generation of AC charging station.
Failure to apply the fix or mitigations provided below may risk buffer overflow attack, which could result in Denial-of-Service.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-01&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-01.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11425

CVE-2024-12399 sev:MED 6.1 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:H/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:L/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its Pro-face GP-Pro EX and Remote HMI products.
The Pro-face GP-Pro EX product is HMI Screen Editor & Logic Programming Software.
The Pro-face Remote HMI product is a remote monitoring software for mobile and allows you to check equipment information on a tablet or smartphone.
Failure to apply the mitigations provided below may risk Man-in-the-Middle attacks which could result in information disclosure, integrity issues and operational failures.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-02&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-02.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12399

CVE-2024-12476 sev:HIGH 8.4 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Designer configuration tool for the following Modicon communication modules:
â¢ BMXNOR0200H
â¢ BMXNOE0110(H)
â¢ BMENOC0311(C)
â¢ BMENOC0321(C)
The Web Designer product is a software application used to create Web-based operator panels and configure operating parameters for Web human machine interface (Web HMI) devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk XML external entity attack, which could result in information disclosure, workstation integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised computer.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-04&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-04.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12476

CVE-2024-12142 sev:HIGH 8.8 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:L/VI:L/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its Web Server on Modicon M340 and BMXNOE0100/0110, BMXNOR0200H communication modules products.
The Modicon M340 is a programmable automation controller; BMXNOE0100 and BMXNOE0110 are network communication modules used with Modicon M340. BMXNOR0200H is a communication module that enables M580 and M340 platforms to use RTU protocol exchange with RTU stations.
Failure to apply the remediation/mitigations provided below may risk information disclosure on web pages, modification of web pages and denial of serviceClick or tap here to enter text., which could result in the unavailability of the controllers or modules.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-05&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-05.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12142

2024-12703 sev:HIGH 8.5 CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of a vulnerability in its RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities software product.
The RemoteConnect and SCADAPackTM x70 Utilities product is a configuration software providing a user interface that allows users to configure and manage communications and operations for SCADAPackTM x70 devices.
Failure to apply the Mitigations provided below may risk deserialization of untrusted data, which could result in loss of confidentiality, integrity and potential remote code execution on the compromised workstation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-06&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-06.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12703

CVE-2024-10497 sev:HIGH 8.7 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N
and
CVE-2024-10498 sev:MED 6.9 CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Schneider Electric is aware of multiple vulnerabilities in its PowerLogicâ¢ HDPM6000 High-Density Metering System product.
The HDPM6000 products are high-density, multi-circuit busway and panelboard power meters for cost and network management in large and critical power applications.
Failure to apply the remediation provided below may risk a low privileged user gaining higher level access, which could allow for modification of system configuration parameters or an unauthenticated user causing data corruption or denial of service to the devices web interface via a specially crafted Modbus protocol write operation.

https://download.schneider-electric.com/files?p_Doc_Ref=SEVD-2025-014-08&p_enDocType=Security+and+Safety+Notice&p_File_Name=SEVD-2025-014-08.pdf

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-10497

CVE-2024-52363
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-17T03:30:34

2 posts

IBM InfoSphere Information Server 11.7 could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system.

cR0w at 2025-01-17T14:10:48.992Z ##

Does IBM think that we ( okay, I'm probably the only weirdo watching these ) won't notice a directory traversal vuln by using a different description? At least they're specially crafted, right @neurovagrant ?

An attacker could send a specially crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system.

https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7176515

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52363

#directoryTraversalMemes

screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T00:46:32.948Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center, 16 January 2025
CVE-2025-21325 (7.8 high) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

How could an attacker exploit this vulnerability and what privileges could an attacker gain?
An authenticated attacker could escalate privileges to Secure Kernel by overwriting the page table data meant for the kernel.

What architecture(s) are impacted by this vulnerability?
This vulnerability impacts ARM64 only.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely ð¤
Goat notes:

  • this is an unusual "out of band" since Patch Tuesday was two days ago.
  • This feels very specific as I'm not sure how many 64-bit version of Windows run on ARM64 processors.
  • Credited to Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering, so they're definitely mucking around in OS.

#microsoft #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2025_21325 #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T00:46:32.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center, 16 January 2025
CVE-2025-21325 (7.8 high) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

How could an attacker exploit this vulnerability and what privileges could an attacker gain?
An authenticated attacker could escalate privileges to Secure Kernel by overwriting the page table data meant for the kernel.

What architecture(s) are impacted by this vulnerability?
This vulnerability impacts ARM64 only.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely ð¤
Goat notes:

  • this is an unusual "out of band" since Patch Tuesday was two days ago.
  • This feels very specific as I'm not sure how many 64-bit version of Windows run on ARM64 processors.
  • Credited to Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering, so they're definitely mucking around in OS.

#microsoft #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2025_21325 #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-12805
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-17T03:15:07.167000

1 posts

A post-authentication format string vulnerability in SonicOS management allows a remote attacker to crash a firewall and potentially leads to code execution.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-12803
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-17T03:15:06.973000

1 posts

A post-authentication stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in SonicOS management allows a remote attacker to crash a firewall and potentially leads to code execution.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-50603
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.73%

updated 2025-01-17T02:00:02.040000

18 posts

An issue was discovered in Aviatrix Controller before 7.1.4191 and 7.2.x before 7.2.4996. Due to the improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS command, an unauthenticated attacker is able to execute arbitrary code. Shell metacharacters can be sent to /v1/api in cloud_type for list_flightpath_destination_instances, or src_cloud_type for flightpath_connection_test.

Nuclei template

2 repos

https://github.com/newlinesec/CVE-2024-50603

https://github.com/th3gokul/CVE-2024-50603

CVE-2024-50603 (perfect 10.0 critical ð¥³) Aviatrix Controller RCE. Wiz Research identified evidence of successful exploitation of this vulnerability across several cloud environments. Indicators of compromise provided.

When deployed in AWS cloud environments, Aviatrix Controller allows privilege escalation by default

CVE-2024-57704(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-17T00:30:55

4 posts

Tenda AC8v4 V16.03.34.06 has a stack overflow vulnerability. Affected by this vulnerability is the function setSchedWifi of the file /goform/openSchedWifi. The manipulation of the argument schedStartTime leads to stack-based buffer overflow.

CVE-2024-46450(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-17T00:30:55

2 posts

Incorrect access control in Tenda AC1200 Smart Dual-Band WiFi Router Model AC6 v2.0 Firmware v15.03.06.50 allows attackers to bypass authentication via a crafted web request.

cR0w at 2025-01-16T22:50:36.592Z ##

Is the Tenda AC1200 Smart Dual-Band WiFi Router popular? Because CVE-2024-46450 is kind of funny:

https://pastebin.com/BXxTqsZk

[Example]
When the login page request is intercepted by tools like BurpSuite, we can see
something like that:
POST /login/Auth HTTP1/1
...
username=admin&password=37a749d808e46495a8da1e5352d03cae

If we change username and password with "user", we will be able to login.

username=user&password=user

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T22:50:36.000Z ##

CVE-2025-22912 â Reolink CMD Injection Vulnerability

CVE-2024-57015
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-16T15:33:16

2 posts

TOTOLINK X5000R V9.1.0cu.2350_B20230313 was discovered to contain an OS command injection vulnerability via the "hour" parameter in setScheduleCfg.

cR0w at 2025-01-15T18:24:34.207Z ##

@screaminggoat Add TOTOLINK "The Smartest Network Device" to that list of weak links too.

https://github.com/tiger5671/Vulnerabilities/tree/main/TOTOLINK%20X5000R

In totolink X5000r v9.1.0cu.2350_b20230313, the file /web/cgi-bin/cstecgi.cgi contains a OS command injection vulnerability in setScheduleCfg. Authenicated Attackers can send malicious packet to execute arbitary commands.

CVE-2024-57011
CVE-2024-57012
CVE-2024-57013
CVE-2024-57014
CVE-2024-57015

In totolink X5000r v9.1.0cu.2350_b20230313, the file /web/cgi-bin/cstecgi.cgi contains a OS command injection vulnerability in setVpnAccountCfg. Authenicated Attackers can send malicious packet to execute arbitary commands.

CVE-2024-57016
CVE-2024-57017
CVE-2024-57018
CVE-2024-57019

In totolink X5000r v9.1.0cu.2350_b20230313, the file /web/cgi-bin/cstecgi.cgi contains a OS command injection vulnerability in setWiFiScheduleCfg. Authenicated Attackers can send malicious packet to execute arbitary commands.

CVE-2024-57020
CVE-2024-57021
CVE-2024-57022
CVE-2024-57023
CVE-2024-57024

CVE-2024-57015

In totolink X5000r v9.1.0cu.2350_b20230313, the file /web/cgi-bin/cstecgi.cgi contains a OS command injection vulnerability in setVpnAccountCfg. Authenicated Attackers can send malicious packet to execute arbitary commands.

CVE-2024-54540
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-16T15:33:16

1 posts

The issue was addressed with improved input sanitization. This issue is fixed in Apple Music 1.5.0.152 for Windows. Processing maliciously crafted web content may disclose internal states of the app.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T02:57:14.000Z ##

Apple security advisory 13 January 2025: About the security content of Apple Music 1.5.0.152 for Windows
CVE-2024-54540 (score pending) Processing maliciously crafted web content may disclose internal states of the app. The issue was addressed with improved input sanitization.

No mention of exploitation. cc: @applsec

#apple #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2025-0471
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-16T15:32:20

5 posts

Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in the PMB platform, affecting versions 4.0.10 and above. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to upload a file to gain remote access to the machine, being able to access, modify and execute commands freely.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-17T06:01:07.000Z ##

CVE-2025-0471 â Apache PMB Arbitary File Upload Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-0471 Published : Jan. 16, 2025, 1:15 p.m. | 16 hours, 45 minutes ago Description : Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in the PMB platform, affecting versions 4.0.10 and above. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to upload a file to gain remote access to the machine, being able to access, modify and execute commands freely. Severity: 9.9 | CRITICAL Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected products, timeline, and more... Go to Source

CVE-2025-22913 â RE11S Stack Overflow Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-22913

Published : Jan. 16, 2025, 3:15 a.m. | 1 day, 2 hours ago

Description : RE11S v1.11 was discovered to contain a stack overflow via the rootAPmac parameter in the formStaDrvSetup function.

Severity: 9.8 | CRITICAL

Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected products, timeline, and moreâ¦

CVE-2024-50563
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-16T12:31:00

2 posts

A weak authentication in Fortinet FortiManager Cloud, FortiAnalyzer versions 7.6.0 through 7.6.1, 7.4.1 through 7.4.3, FortiAnalyzer Cloud versions 7.4.1 through 7.4.3, FortiManager versions 7.6.0 through 7.6.1, 7.4.1 through 7.4.3, FortiManager Cloud versions 7.4.1 through 7.4.3 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via a brute-force attack.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!

  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File

  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy

CVE-2025-22146
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-15T22:01:23

2 posts

### Impact A critical vulnerability was discovered in the SAML SSO implementation of Sentry. It was reported to us via our private bug bounty program. The vulnerability allows an attacker to take over any user account by using a malicious SAML Identity Provider and another organization on the same Sentry instance. The victim email address must be known in order to exploit this vulnerability. ###

cR0w at 2025-01-15T20:46:43.687Z ##

Does anyone use Sentry? Of course someone here uses it. Here's a sev:CRIT to allow user impersonation:

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/security/advisories/GHSA-7pq6-v88g-wf3w

A critical vulnerability was discovered in the SAML SSO implementation of Sentry. It was reported to us via our private bug bounty program.

The vulnerability allows an attacker to take over any user account by using a malicious SAML Identity Provider and another organization on the same Sentry instance. The victim email address must be known in order to exploit this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22146

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-15T20:46:43.000Z ##

Does anyone use Sentry? Of course someone here uses it. Here's a sev:CRIT to allow user impersonation:

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/security/advisories/GHSA-7pq6-v88g-wf3w

A critical vulnerability was discovered in the SAML SSO implementation of Sentry. It was reported to us via our private bug bounty program.

The vulnerability allows an attacker to take over any user account by using a malicious SAML Identity Provider and another organization on the same Sentry instance. The victim email address must be known in order to exploit this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22146

updated 2025-01-15T15:32:27

2 posts

screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T19:32:10.646Z ##

Microsoft security advisories 17 January 2025:

  • CVE-2025-21185 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21399 (7.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Update Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. For convenience I won't list out the 13 other patched vulnerabilities from CVE-2025-0434 through 0448 (skipped 0444-0445) that were first announced by Google Chrome on 14 January 2025.

#microsoft #edge #chrome #chromium #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-12084
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2025-01-15T15:31:35

31 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the rsync daemon. This issue is due to improper handling of attacker-controlled checksum lengths (s2length) in the code. When MAX_DIGEST_LEN exceeds the fixed SUM_LENGTH (16 bytes), an attacker can write out of bounds in the sum2 buffer.

FoW@netsphere.one at 2025-01-16T05:45:10.000Z ##

https://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2024-12084/

##
benzucker@maly.io at 2025-01-16T04:37:49.000Z ##

Neat to know. #debian fixed a critical issue with #rsync (RCE, CVSS 9.8, CVE-2024-12084) back in December already. Awesome.

##
jay@macaw.social at 2025-01-16T02:01:19.000Z ##

Yikes
https://www.cyberciti.biz/linux-news/cve-2024-12084-rsyn-security-urgent-update-needed-on-unix-bsd-systems/

##
nixCraft@mastodon.social at 2025-01-15T18:06:49.000Z ##

The rsync utility in Linux, *BSD, and Unix-like systems are vulnerable to multiple security issues, including arbitrary code execution, arbitrary file upload, information disclosure, and privilege escalation. Hence, you must patch the system ASAP https://www.cyberciti.biz/linux-news/cve-2024-12084-rsyn-security-urgent-update-needed-on-unix-bsd-systems/

#infosec #security #linux #unix

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T07:09:04.000Z ##

CVE-2024-12084 (CVSS 9.8) â Code Execution Risk: Rsync Vulnerability Demands Immediate Patching

CVE-2024-12084 (CVSS 9.8) â Code Execution Risk: Rsync Vulnerability Demands Immediate Patching Rsync, a widely-used file synchronization tool, has been found to harbor six vulnerabilities affecting versions 3.3.0 and below. These vulnerabilities, ranging from heap-buffer overflows to symbolic l ... Read more Published Date: [â¦]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2024-12084-cvss-9-8-code-execution-risk-rsync-vulnerability-demands-immediate-patching/3697/

##
SoLSec@mastodon.social at 2025-01-15T05:58:16.000Z ##

Fixes for a critical rsync vulnerability (CVE-2024-12084) have been released for Stable/Bookworm, Testing and Unstable. Oldstable/Bullseye is not affected. Fixes for other lower severity CVEs have also been released in the same update and can all be tracked at https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/source-package/rsync. The fixed Stable version is 3.2.7-1+deb12u1 and the fixed Testing/Unstabl https://micronews.debian.org/2025/1736709733.html

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-14T23:52:57.000Z ##

CVE-2024-12084 is fun - unauth RCE in rsyncd, the server side version. 3.2.7 and < 3.4.0.

Apt-get upgrade time.

I donât think thereâs a public exploit, and unclear to me (as Iâm a dum dum) if various mitigations would work to limit impact, eg compiler, ASLR, PIE etc.

_r_netsec at 2025-01-14T22:43:06.444Z ##

Anybody know whether the issue in CVE-2024-12084 is strictly within "rsyncd", or does this also affect "rsync --server --sender"?

If so, then that would impact a lot more deployments, i.e., those that depend on SSH as the transport.

##
elfy@chaos.social at 2025-01-14T18:47:52.000Z ##

Service toot for sysadmin folks:

There's six vulnerabilities in #rsync, including a CVSS of 9.8: "In the most severe CVE, an attacker only requires
anonymous read access to a rsync server, such as a public mirror, to
execute arbitrary code on the machine the server is running on."

Full report of all six vulnerabilities: https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/01/14/3

The most critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-12084) seems to be fixed in Debian Stable atm: https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/source-package/rsync

#cybercybercyber #PatchThePlanet

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-01-14T18:26:09.000Z ##

6 new CVEs in "rsync".

"In the most severe CVE, an attacker only requires anonymous read access to a rsync server, such as a public mirror, to execute arbitrary code on the machine the server is running on."

That would be CVE-2024-12084 (9.8) AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H, a heap-based buffer overflow in rsyncd.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/01/14/3

##
samueloph@mastodon.social at 2025-01-14T18:26:03.000Z ##

-- CRITICAL CVE UPDATE FOR DEBIAN--

Fixes for a critical rsync vulnerability (CVE-2024-12084) have been released for Stable/Bookworm, Testing and Unstable. Oldstable/Bullseye is not affected. Fixes for other lower severity CVEs have also been released in the same update and can all be tracked at https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/source-package/rsync. The fixed Stable version is 3.2.7-1+deb12u1 and the fixed Testing/Unstable version is 3.3.0+ds1-3

Debian should publish a micronews article about this soon.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,âsafe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

#vulnerability #rsync #vulnerability #linux #infosec #cve #cybersecurity

The rsync utility in Linux, *BSD, and Unix-like systems are vulnerable to multiple security issues, including arbitrary code execution, arbitrary file upload, information disclosure, and privilege escalation. Service toot for sysadmin folks:

There's six vulnerabilities in #rsync, including a CVSS of 9.8: "In the most severe CVE, an attacker only requires
anonymous read access to a rsync server, such as a public mirror, to
execute arbitrary code on the machine the server is running on."

jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-01-14T18:26:09.000Z ##

6 new CVEs in "rsync".

"In the most severe CVE, an attacker only requires anonymous read access to a rsync server, such as a public mirror, to execute arbitrary code on the machine the server is running on."

That would be CVE-2024-12084 (9.8) AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H, a heap-based buffer overflow in rsyncd.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/01/14/3

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to register on the site as an administrator.

##

CVE-2024-12085
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-15T09:30:49

4 posts

A flaw was found in the rsync daemon which could be triggered when rsync compares file checksums. This flaw allows an attacker to manipulate the checksum length (s2length) to cause a comparison between a checksum and uninitialized memory and leak one byte of uninitialized stack data at a time.

eslerm@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-15T01:22:18.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog ASLR does not mitigate this, but compiling with `-ftrivial-auto-var-init=zero` mitigates the leak (CVE-2024-12085)

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,âsafe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

#vulnerability #rsync #vulnerability #linux #infosec #cve #cybersecurity

##
eslerm@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-15T01:22:18.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog ASLR does not mitigate this, but compiling with `-ftrivial-auto-var-init=zero` mitigates the leak (CVE-2024-12085)

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.000Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,âsafe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

CVE-2024-55577
(7.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-15T06:15:16.740000

1 posts

Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Linux Ratfor 1.06 and earlier. When the software processes a file which is specially crafted by an attacker, arbitrary code may be executed. As a result, the attacker may obtain or alter information of the user environment or cause the user environment to become unusable.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T07:09:29.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-12747
(5.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-15T00:30:41

4 posts

A flaw was found in rsync. This vulnerability arises from a race condition during rsync's handling of symbolic links. Rsync's default behavior when encountering symbolic links is to skip them. If an attacker replaced a regular file with a symbolic link at the right time, it was possible to bypass the default behavior and traverse symbolic links. Depending on the privileges of the rsync process, an

vkc@linuxmom.net at 2025-01-15T22:42:43.000Z ##

It's already been talked about a bunch but update your servers to patch up this rsync vulnerability.

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-12747

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,âsafe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

##

CVE-2024-12087
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-15T00:30:40

2 posts

A path traversal vulnerability exists in rsync. It stems from behavior enabled by the `--inc-recursive` option, a default-enabled option for many client options and can be enabled by the server even if not explicitly enabled by the client. When using the `--inc-recursive` option, a lack of proper symlink verification coupled with deduplication checks occurring on a per-file-list basis could allow

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21362

##

CVE-2024-12088
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T22:15:26.600000

4 posts

A flaw was found in rsync. When using the `--safe-links` option, rsync fails to properly verify if a symbolic link destination contains another symbolic link within it. This results in a path traversal vulnerability, which may lead to arbitrary file write outside the desired directory.

cR0w at 2025-01-14T18:46:24.703Z ##

@grey @screaminggoat Still laughing at CVE-2024-12088:

A flaw was found in rsync. When using the --safe-links option, rsync fails to properly verify if a symbolic link destination contains another symbolic link within it. This results in a path traversal vulnerability, which may lead to arbitrary file write outside the desired directory.

Talk about false advertising.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,âsafe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

#vulnerability #rsync #vulnerability #linux #infosec #cve #cybersecurity

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T18:46:24.000Z ##

@grey @screaminggoat Still laughing at CVE-2024-12088:

A flaw was found in rsync. When using the --safe-links option, rsync fails to properly verify if a symbolic link destination contains another symbolic link within it. This results in a path traversal vulnerability, which may lead to arbitrary file write outside the desired directory.

Talk about false advertising.

CVE-2024-12086
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T22:15:26.370000

2 posts

A flaw was found in rsync. It could allow a server to enumerate the contents of an arbitrary file from the client's machine. This issue occurs when files are being copied from a client to a server. During this process, the rsync server will send checksums of local data to the client to compare with in order to determine what data needs to be sent to the server. By sending specially constructed che

Improper input validation in the PCX image codec in QNX SDP versions 8.0, 7.1 and 7.0 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition in the context of the process using the image codec.

cR0w at 2025-01-14T19:28:55.370Z ##

I did not wake up this morning expecting to see a critical RCE in Blackberry QNX, but here we are anyway.

https://support.blackberry.com/pkb/s/article/140334

Out-of-bounds write in the PCX image codec in QNX SDP versions 8.0, 7.1 and 7.0 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition or execute code in the context of the process using the image codec.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48856

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T18:20:15.987Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: EIGHT ZERO-DAYS (3 exploited, 5 publicly disclosed, 159 new CVEs)

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21308 (6.5 medium) Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21275 (7.8 high) Windows App Package Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21186 (7.8 high) Microsoft Access Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21395 (7.8 high) Microsoft Access Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21366 (7.8 high) Microsoft Access Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T20:18:36.997Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

#fortinet #microsoft #zeroday #cve #vulnerability #eitw #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #cisakev #cisa #infosec #cybersecurity

Product: Windows
Date Added: 2025-01-14

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T20:18:36.997Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T20:18:36.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

CVE-2025-21308
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-14T18:32:15

4 posts

Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2025-01-16T17:43:19.271Z ##

The public disclosure of CVE-2025-21308 was an easy find, considering that 0patch was credited with reporting the vulnerability. 0patch even updated their blog's title! See 0patch blog from 29 October 2025: We Patched CVE-2024-38030, Found Another Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability (initially 0day, now CVE-2025-21308)

nflatrea at 2025-01-15T21:46:24.081Z ##

Windows OLE Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-21298

##
_r_netsec at 2025-01-14T19:43:06.526Z ##

New Microsoft OLE Vulnerability, Exploitable via Email https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21298

##
mttaggart at 2025-01-14T19:33:08.606Z ##

Well dang CVE-2025-21298

This bug rates a CVSS 9.8 and allows a remote attacker to execute code on a target system by sending a specially crafted mail to an affected system with Outlook. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of RTF files.

https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2025/1/14/the-january-2025-security-update-review

##
_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T19:43:06.000Z ##
