##

CVE-2025-23025
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T18:16:05.650000

10 posts

XWiki Platform is a generic wiki platform offering runtime services for applications built on top of it. NOTE: The Realtime WYSIWYG Editor extension was **experimental**, and thus **not recommended**, in the versions affected by this vulnerability. It has become enabled by default, and thus recommended, starting with XWiki 16.9.0. A user with only **edit right** can join a realtime editing session

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T07:09:24.000Z ##

CVE-2025-23025 â XWiki Platform Script Injection Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-23025 Published : Jan. 14, 2025, 6:16 p.m. | 12 hours, 53 minutes ago Description : XWiki Platform is a generic wiki platform offering runtime services for applications built on top of it. NOTE: The Realtime WYSIWYG Editor extension was **experimental**, and thus **not recommended**, in the versions affected by this vulnerability. It has become enabled by default, and thus recommended, starting with XWiki 16.9.0. A user with only **edit right** can join a realtime [â¦]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2025-23025-xwiki-platform-script-injection-vulnerability/3721/

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: EIGHT ZERO-DAYS (3 exploited, 5 publicly disclosed, 159 new CVEs)

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21308 (6.5 medium) Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21275 (7.8 high) Windows App Package Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21186 (7.8 high) Microsoft Access Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21395 (7.8 high) Microsoft Access Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

CVE-2024-7344
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T17:15:20.383000

24 posts

Howyar UEFI Application "Reloader" (32-bit and 64-bit) is vulnerable to execution of unsigned software in a hardcoded path.

flagthis@ioc.exchange at 2025-01-17T13:19:51.000Z ##

##
lavxnews@mastodon.cloud at 2025-01-16T15:22:53.000Z ##

Critical UEFI Secure Boot Flaw Exposes Systems to Bootkit Attacks

A newly discovered vulnerability in UEFI Secure Boot, tracked as CVE-2024-7344, poses a significant risk by allowing attackers to deploy bootkits even when Secure Boot is enabled. This article delves ...

https://news.lavx.hu/article/critical-uefi-secure-boot-flaw-exposes-systems-to-bootkit-attacks

lavxnews@mastodon.cloud at 2025-01-16T15:22:53.000Z ##

Critical UEFI Secure Boot Flaw Exposes Systems to Bootkit Attacks

A newly discovered vulnerability in UEFI Secure Boot, tracked as CVE-2024-7344, poses a significant risk by allowing attackers to deploy bootkits even when Secure Boot is enabled. This article delves ...

https://news.lavx.hu/article/critical-uefi-secure-boot-flaw-exposes-systems-to-bootkit-attacks

#news #tech #SecureBoot #CVE20247344 #Bootkits

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T14:46:25.324Z ##

ESET Research: Under the cloak of UEFI Secure Boot: Introducing CVE-2024-7344
ESET discovered a vulnerability that allows bypassing Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) Secure Boot on most UEFI-based systems. CVE-2024-7344 (6.5 medium) is in a UEFI app signed by Microsoft's 3rd-party UEFI certificate. The vulnerability is caused by the use of an unsafe PE/COFF-loading (Portable Executable (PE)/Common Object File Format (COFF)) mechanism, lacking any Secure Boot-related checks, which allows loading arbitrary (even unsigned) UEFI applications. The vulnerability is now fixed, and the old, vulnerable binaries were revoked by Microsoft in the January 14th Patch Tuesday update.

#vulnerability #UEFI #CVE_2024_7344 #infosec #cybersecurity #microsoft

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T14:46:25.000Z ##

ESET Research: Under the cloak of UEFI Secure Boot: Introducing CVE-2024-7344
ESET discovered a vulnerability that allows bypassing Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) Secure Boot on most UEFI-based systems. CVE-2024-7344 (6.5 medium) is in a UEFI app signed by Microsoft's 3rd-party UEFI certificate. The vulnerability is caused by the use of an unsafe PE/COFF-loading (Portable Executable (PE)/Common Object File Format (COFF)) mechanism, lacking any Secure Boot-related checks, which allows loading arbitrary (even unsigned) UEFI applications. The vulnerability is now fixed, and the old, vulnerable binaries were revoked by Microsoft in the January 14th Patch Tuesday update.

#vulnerability #UEFI #CVE_2024_7344 #infosec #cybersecurity #microsoft

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-17T20:45:02.000Z ##

Under the cloak of UEFI Secure Boot: Introducing CVE-2024-7344 https://www.welivesecurity.com/en/eset-research/under-cloak-uefi-secure-boot-introducing-cve-2024-7344/

benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2025-01-17T10:40:02.000Z ##

jbhall56 at 2025-01-16T13:01:34.409Z ##

The vulnerability, assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-7344 (CVSS score: 6.7), resides in a UEFI application signed by Microsoft's "Microsoft Corporation UEFI CA 2011" third-party UEFI certificate, according to a new report from ESET. https://thehackernews.com/2025/01/new-uefi-secure-boot-vulnerability.html

##

CVE-2024-10630
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T17:15:13.857000

2 posts

A race condition in Ivanti Application Control Engine before version 10.14.4.0 allows a local authenticated attacker to bypass the application blocking functionality.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.574Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: January Security Update
Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.000Z ##

Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

##

CVE-2025-0282
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 15.32%

updated 2025-01-14T15:59:38.157000

69 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

7 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/CVE-2025-0282

https://github.com/securexploit1/CVE-2025-0282

https://github.com/absholi7ly/CVE-2025-0282-Ivanti-exploit

https://github.com/sfewer-r7/CVE-2025-0282

https://github.com/AnonStorks/CVE-2025-0282-Full-version

https://github.com/NyxanGoat/CVE-2025-0282-PoC

https://github.com/rxwx/pulse-meter

screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T01:22:17.394Z ##

Unit 42: Threat Brief: CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283
You guys remember the Ivanti zero-day? LOL that was only last week!! Fuck 2025, this is the absolute worst timeline. We must have died in 2012 like the Mayans predicted and we've just been living in hell ever since.

Anyway the most useful information in this blog post is attacker behavior and post-exploitation activity. The threat cluster is named CL-UNK-0979. Indicators of compromise are shared.

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
So hot off the press that it's not live yet ð¥µð¥ð¥
CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

Today's Ivanti exploited zero-day has been added to the CISA KEV Catalog cc: @ntkramer

screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T01:22:17.394Z ##

Unit 42: Threat Brief: CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283
You guys remember the Ivanti zero-day? LOL that was only last week!! Fuck 2025, this is the absolute worst timeline. We must have died in 2012 like the Mayans predicted and we've just been living in hell ever since.

Anyway the most useful information in this blog post is attacker behavior and post-exploitation activity. The threat cluster is named CL-UNK-0979. Indicators of compromise are shared.

#ivanti #zeroday #CVE_2025_0282 #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #IOC #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-12T14:12:33.553Z ##

watchTowr: Exploitation Walkthrough and Techniques - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
See parent toots for details. Following up on the root cause analysis of CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability, watchTowr provides a walkthrough of how they approached exploiting the vulnerability. They intend to publicly release a "Detection Artifact Generator" (read: proof of concept) until 16 January 2025 (another 4 days) cc: @wdormann

#ivanti #CVE_2025_0282 #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cisakev #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

I'm here for the McMemes and I'm lovin' it.Â® watchTowr does not provide the proof of concept but it's not necessary as it's already being exploited in the wild by threat actors.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T17:49:20.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
So hot off the press that it's not live yet ð¥µð¥ð¥
CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

Today's Ivanti exploited zero-day has been added to the CISA KEV Catalog cc: @ntkramer

#cisa #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #ivanti #CVE_2025_0282

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.574Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: January Security Update
Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

13reak@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-10T16:45:45.000Z ##

##

CVE-2025-0283
(7.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:58:55.813000

26 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a local authenticated attacker to escalate their privileges.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-13T08:40:03.000Z ##

Ivanti Rolls Out Patches to Mitigate Exploits in Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways https://thecyberexpress.com/ivanti-vulnerabilities-patches-roll-out/ #Ivantivulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #IvantiPolicySecure #VulnerabilityNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20250282 #CVE20250283 #CyberNews

Unit 42 Threat Brief: CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283 (Updated today) https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/threat-brief-ivanti-cve-2025-0282-cve-2025-0283/ @unit42_intel #cybersecurity #Infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T01:22:17.394Z ##

Unit 42: Threat Brief: CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283
You guys remember the Ivanti zero-day? LOL that was only last week!! Fuck 2025, this is the absolute worst timeline. We must have died in 2012 like the Mayans predicted and we've just been living in hell ever since.

Anyway the most useful information in this blog post is attacker behavior and post-exploitation activity. The threat cluster is named CL-UNK-0979. Indicators of compromise are shared.

#ivanti #zeroday #CVE_2025_0282 #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #IOC #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.574Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: January Security Update
Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)

##
Hackread@mstdn.social at 2025-01-10T21:30:42.000Z ##

ð¨ Urgent Security Alert: Ivanti reveals critical vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-0282 & CVE-2025-0283) in Connect Secure, Policy Secure, & ZTA Gateways. Patch Connect Secure now (v22.7R2.5) & isolate affected systems.

Read: https://hackread.com/ivanti-patch-flaws-connect-secure-policy-secure-zta-gateways/

#CyberSecurity #PatchNow

##

CVE-2024-46667
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:32:01

2 posts

A allocation of resources without limits or throttling in Fortinet FortiSIEM 5.3 all versions, 5.4 all versions, 6.x all versions, 7.0 all versions, and 7.1.0 through 7.1.5 may allow an attacker to deny valid TLS traffic via consuming all allotted connections.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature

  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

CVE-2024-47572
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:32:01

2 posts

An improper neutralization of formula elements in a csv file in Fortinet FortiSOAR 7.2.1 through 7.4.1 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via manipulating csv file

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update

  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection

  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File

  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service

  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike

  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

updated 2025-01-14T15:32:01

2 posts

  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files

  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection

##

CVE-2023-37931
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:32:00

4 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') vulnerability [CWE-88] in FortiVoice Entreprise version 7.0.0 through 7.0.1 and before 6.4.8 allows an authenticated attacker to perform a blind sql injection attack via sending crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

CVE-2024-23106
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:32:00

4 posts

An improper restriction of excessive authentication attempts [CWE-307] in FortiClientEMS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.4 and before 7.0.10 allows an unauthenticated attacker to try a brute force attack against the FortiClientEMS console via crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.

  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:03

  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:03

AnÂ Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability [CWE-125] in FortiOS version 7.6.0, version 7.4.4 and below, version 7.2.9 and below and FortiSASE FortiOS tenant version 24.3.b IPsec IKE service may allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to trigger memory consumption leading to Denial of Service via crafted requests.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-14T15:11:24.000Z ##

The FortiGate issue has an advisory now: https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-266

And a CVE: CVE-2024-46670

Found by some guys at QI-ANXIN Group

Thereâs some eye raising stuff in it but anyhoo, patch. You probably already are since the patches were released a while ago.

It doesnât need management interface access, if you can send IKE packets you can send one which triggers the firewall to consume 90% RAM and fail open some traffic and/or crash.

  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon

  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

##

CVE-2024-55591
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.63%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

45 posts

AnÂ Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS version 7.0.0 through 7.0.16 and FortiProxy version 7.0.0 through 7.0.19 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.12 allows a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests toÂ Node.js websocket module.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-17T05:59:24.000Z ##

CVE-2024-55591 Detection: Critical Zero-Day Vulnerability in Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy Actively Exploited in the Wild

This week, over 700 new vulnerabilities have been identified, continuing the trend of rising security risks for organizations worldwide. Among the most disturbing is CVE-2024-55591, an authentication bypass vulnerability affecting FortiOS and FortiProxy. This critical zero-day flaw exposes FortiGate firewall devices to potential compromise, allowing remote attackers to gain super-admin privileges on the affected systems. Fortinet has confirmed that the vulnerability is actively being [â¦]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2024-55591-detection-critical-zero-day-vulnerability-in-fortinet-fortios-and-fortiproxy-actively-exploited-in-the-wild/4137/

##
catc0n at 2025-01-16T17:22:03.259Z ##

Well this was a little time-consuming to untangle, but it's looking like the two different Fortinet firewall incidents this week are probably unrelated:

1. A new zero-day vulnerability in FortiOS (CVE-2024-55591) is being exploited in the wild and could allow attackers to gain super-admin access. Rapid7 has observed possible reconnaissance but no successful exploitation so far.
2. Separately, a threat actor published IP addresses, passwords, and config data from 15,000 FortiGate devices in a dark web post. The data appears to be from 2022. Rapid7 has not linked a CVE to the mass firewall data leak but has independently confirmed that at least part of that data came from 2022 breaches.

Huge thanks to @GossiTheDog for his super helpful analysis of the FortiDump and subsequent IR observations. It saved me some work hours that got put toward sleep, for which I am massively grateful :)

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2025/01/16/etr-fortinet-firewalls-hit-with-new-zero-day-attack-older-data-leak/

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-16T16:13:48.983Z ##

Rapid7: Fortinet firewalls hit with new zero-day attack, older data leak
Rapid7 confirms that at least some of the leaked Fortinet FortiGate firewall data from Belsen Group originated from 2022 incidents, but currently will not attribute any CVE to the leaked data.

Based on Beaumont's analysis and observations from our own investigations, itâs likely that the data dump published by the threat actor contains primarily or entirely older data.

They also warn about CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability, a recently announced exploited zero-day. While they acknowledge Arctic Wolf's blog post and note overlaps with the IOC in Fortinet's security advisory, "our team has so far only noted connections consistent with scanning or reconnaissance activity and not exploitation." Rapid7 highlights five other historical FortiOS zero-days. No new indicators shared.

##
daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T07:06:54.000Z ##

CVE-2024-55591: Fortinet FortiOS/FortiProxy Zero Day

In late November and December 2024, Arctic Wolf observed evidence of a mass compromise of Fortinet FortiGate. While the initial attack vector was unknown at the time, evidence of compromise (with new users and SSL profiles) was consistent across compromised devices.

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

â ï¸ CVE-2024-55591 in FortiOS (Fortigate firewall) is under exploitation by a ransomware operator, they have a copy of an exploit and are using it for initial access and handing off for lateral movement.

https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-535

Impacts Fortigate 7.0.0 through 7.0.16, you need to upgrade if on those versions and check logs for prior exploitation - threat actor had it as a zero day for over a month, I imagine vendor in IR space will drop writeup soon.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T14:26:32.927Z ##

Happy #ZeroDay from your friends at Fortinet: Authentication bypass in Node.js websocket module
CVE-2024-55591 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical) An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS and FortiProxy may allow a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests to Node.js websocket module.

Please note that reports show this is being exploited in the wild.

Indicators of compromise include possible log entries, IP addresses used, and admin accounts created. cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann @cR0w @briankrebs

#zeroday #patchtuesday #fortinet #vulnerability #CVE_2024_55591 #infosec #ioc #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #fortios #fortiproxy

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T17:22:03.000Z ##

Well this was a little time-consuming to untangle, but it's looking like the two different Fortinet firewall incidents this week are probably unrelated:

1. A new zero-day vulnerability in FortiOS (CVE-2024-55591) is being exploited in the wild and could allow attackers to gain super-admin access. Rapid7 has observed possible reconnaissance but no successful exploitation so far.
2. Separately, a threat actor published IP addresses, passwords, and config data from 15,000 FortiGate devices in a dark web post. The data appears to be from 2022. Rapid7 has not linked a CVE to the mass firewall data leak but has independently confirmed that at least part of that data came from 2022 breaches.

Huge thanks to @GossiTheDog for his super helpful analysis of the FortiDump and subsequent IR observations. It saved me some work hours that got put toward sleep, for which I am massively grateful :)

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2025/01/16/etr-fortinet-firewalls-hit-with-new-zero-day-attack-older-data-leak/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-16T16:13:48.000Z ##

Rapid7: Fortinet firewalls hit with new zero-day attack, older data leak
Rapid7 confirms that at least some of the leaked Fortinet FortiGate firewall data from Belsen Group originated from 2022 incidents, but currently will not attribute any CVE to the leaked data.

Based on Beaumont's analysis and observations from our own investigations, itâs likely that the data dump published by the threat actor contains primarily or entirely older data.

They also warn about CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability, a recently announced exploited zero-day. While they acknowledge Arctic Wolf's blog post and note overlaps with the IOC in Fortinet's security advisory, "our team has so far only noted connections consistent with scanning or reconnaissance activity and not exploitation." Rapid7 highlights five other historical FortiOS zero-days. No new indicators shared.

#fortinet #fortigate #fortios #fortiproxy #vulnerability #zeroday #CVE_2024_55591 #eitw #belsengroup #cybercrime #dataleak #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T20:18:36.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-14T18:12:42.000Z ##

â ï¸ CVE-2024-55591 in FortiOS (Fortigate firewall) is under exploitation by a ransomware operator, they have a copy of an exploit and are using it for initial access and handing off for lateral movement.

https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-535

Impacts Fortigate 7.0.0 through 7.0.16, you need to upgrade if on those versions and check logs for prior exploitation - threat actor had it as a zero day for over a month, I imagine vendor in IR space will drop writeup soon.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T14:26:32.000Z ##

Happy #ZeroDay from your friends at Fortinet: Authentication bypass in Node.js websocket module
CVE-2024-55591 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical) An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS and FortiProxy may allow a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests to Node.js websocket module.

Please note that reports show this is being exploited in the wild.

Indicators of compromise include possible log entries, IP addresses used, and admin accounts created. cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann @cR0w @briankrebs

#zeroday #patchtuesday #fortinet #vulnerability #CVE_2024_55591 #infosec #ioc #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #fortios #fortiproxy

CVE-2024-33502
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

An improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory ('path traversal') in Fortinet FortiManager, FortiAnalyzer versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.2 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.12 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.14 and 6.2.0 through 6.2.12 and 6.0.0 through 6.0.12 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted HTTP or HTTPs requests.

CVE-2024-50564
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

A use of hard-coded cryptographic key in Fortinet FortiClientWindows version 7.4.0, 7.2.x all versions, 7.0.x all versions, and 6.4.x all versions may allow a low-privileged user to decrypt interprocess communication via monitoring named piped.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature

  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

CVE-2024-35275
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') in Fortinet FortiAnalyzer version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2, FortiManager version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2 allows attacker to escalation of privilege via specially crafted http requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

2 posts

##

CVE-2024-54021
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

An improper neutralization of crlf sequences in http headers ('http response splitting') in Fortinet FortiOS 7.2.0 through 7.6.0, FortiProxy 7.2.0 through 7.4.5 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted HTTP header.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-52963
(3.7 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

A out-of-bounds write in Fortinet FortiOS versions 7.6.0, 7.4.0 through 7.4.6, 7.2.0 through 7.2.10, 7.0.0 through 7.0.16, 6.4.0 through 6.4.15 allows attacker to trigger a denial of service via specially crafted packets.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface

(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

2 posts

A null pointer dereference in FortiOS versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.1, 7.2.0 through 7.2.5, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions , 6.2 all versions and 6.0 all versions allows attacker to trigger a denial of service via a crafted http request.

##

CVE-2024-27778
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

2 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS Command vulnerability [CWE-78] in Fortinet FortiSandbox version 4.4.0 through 4.4.4, 4.2.0 through 4.2.6 and below 4.0.4 allows an authenticated attacker with at least read-only permission to execute unauthorized commands via crafted requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##

CVE-2023-46715
(5.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

4 posts

An origin validation error [CWE-346] vulnerability in Fortinet FortiOS IPSec VPN version 7.4.0 through 7.4.1 and version 7.2.6 and below allows an authenticated IPSec VPN user with dynamic IP addressing to send (but not receive) packets spoofing the IP of another user via crafted network packets.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

##

CVE-2024-21758
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

4 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Fortinet FortiWeb versions 7.2.0 through 7.2.7, and 7.4.0 through 7.4.1 may allow a privileged user to execute arbitrary code via specially crafted CLI commands, provided the user is able to evade FortiWeb stack protections.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

##

CVE-2024-32115
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

2 posts

A relative path traversal vulnerability [CWE-23] in Fortinet FortiManager version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2 and before 7.2.5 allows a privileged attacker to delete files from the underlying filesystem via crafted HTTP or HTTPs requests.

  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

CVE-2023-42786
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

4 posts

A null pointer dereference in FortiOS versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.1, 7.2.0 through 7.2.5, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions , 6.2 all versions and 6.0 all versions allows attacker to trigger a denial of service via a crafted http request.

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI

    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!

CVE-2024-36512
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:54

4 posts

An improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory ('path traversal') in Fortinet FortiManager, FortiAnalyzer 7.4.0 through 7.4.3 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.2 through 7.0.12 and 6.2.10 through 6.2.13 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.
