  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

##
cR0w at 2025-01-14T14:45:54.997Z ##

Okay, one more, but only because it's a ../

https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-152

A relative path traversal vulnerability [CWE-23] in FortiManager & FortiAnalyzer may allow a privileged attacker with super-admin profile and CLI access to write files on the underlying system via crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-36512

You can get the rest of your own Fortinet cringe: https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy

  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection

##

CVE-2024-50566
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:33.650000

4 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiManager versions 7.6.0 through 7.6.1, versions 7.4.5 through 7.4.0, and versions 7.2.1 through 7.2.8, FortiManager Cloud versions 7.6.0 through 7.6.1, versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.4, and versions 7.2.2 through 7.2.7 may allow an authenticated remote attacker to execute unauthorized code via

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:58:18.754Z ##

Fortinet big mad about watchTowr: FG-IR-24-463
CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection

This vulnerability was publiclly disclosed by Watchtowr, without following industry standard responsible disclosure process, and advertised via their X account.

Note that to the best of our knowledge, this vulnerability has not been observed to be exploited in the wild.

cc: @GossiTheDog This appears to be #fortijumphigher: watchTowr: Hop-Skip-FortiJump-FortiJump-Higher - Fortinet FortiManager CVE-2024-47575 from 15 November 2024.

CVE-2024-46665
(3.7 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:31.490000

2 posts

An insertion of sensitive information into sent data vulnerability [CWE-201] in FortiOS 7.6.0, 7.4.0 through 7.4.4 may allow an attacker in a man-in-the-middle position to retrieve the RADIUS accounting server shared secret via intercepting accounting-requests.

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

##

CVE-2024-35273
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:29.663000

2 posts

A out-of-bounds write in Fortinet FortiManager version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2, FortiAnalyzer version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2 allows attacker to escalation of privilege via specially crafted http requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI

  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon

##

CVE-2023-37937
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:26.940000

4 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSwitch version 7.4.0 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.7 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.13 and 6.2.0 through 6.2.7 and 6.0.0 through 6.0.7 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via the FortiSwitch CLI.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature

##
cR0w at 2025-01-14T14:25:36.099Z ##

There's also a post-auth command injection in FortiSwitch but that's less fun. It's also a 2023 CVE but dated for publish today.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-258

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSwitch version 7.4.0 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.7 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.13 and 6.2.0 through 6.2.7 and 6.0.0 through 6.0.7 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via the FortiSwitch CLI.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37937

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T14:25:36.000Z ##

There's also a post-auth command injection in FortiSwitch but that's less fun. It's also a 2023 CVE but dated for publish today.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-258

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSwitch version 7.4.0 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.7 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.13 and 6.2.0 through 6.2.7 and 6.0.0 through 6.0.7 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via the FortiSwitch CLI.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37937

##

CVE-2023-37936
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:26.790000

5 posts

A use of hard-coded cryptographic key in Fortinet FortiSwitch version 7.4.0 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.7 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.13 and 6.2.0 through 6.2.7 and 6.0.0 through 6.0.7 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted requests.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T14:17:19.000Z ##

CVE-2023-37936 (CVSS 9.6): Urgent Patch Needed for FortiSwitch Vulnerability

CVE-2023-37936 (CVSS 9.6): Urgent Patch Needed for FortiSwitch Vulnerability Fortinet has issued patches to address a critical security vulnerability (CVE-2023-37936, CVSS 9.6) affecting its FortiSwitch product line. The vulnerability could allow remote, unauthenticated attack ... Read more Published Date: Jan 15, 2025 [â¦]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2023-37936-cvss-9-6-urgent-patch-needed-for-fortiswitch-vulnerability/3923/

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

cR0w at 2025-01-14T14:23:28.631Z ##

Ooh, is 2025 really going to be the year of hardcoded creds? Fortinet off to a good start with a sev:CRIT in FortiSwitch.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-260

A use of hard-coded cryptographic key vulnerability [CWE-321] in FortiSwitch may allow a remote unauthenticated attacker in posession of the key to execute unauthorized code via crafted cryptographic requests.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37936

Note that the advisory and CVE are dated for today but it's a 2023 CVE. ð

CVE-2024-56841
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-14T12:31:57

2 posts

A vulnerability has been identified in Mendix LDAP (All versions < V1.1.2). Affected versions of the module are vulnerable to LDAP injection. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to bypass username verification.

cR0w at 2025-01-14T13:55:23.538Z ##

Well that doesn't seem ideal. Critical LDAP injection in Siemens Mendix LDAP modules. Kind of seems like one of those "you had one job things" but then I look at firewalls, VPN concentrators, etc.

https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/html/ssa-314390.html

A vulnerability has been identified in Mendix LDAP (All versions < V1.1.2). Affected versions of the module are vulnerable to LDAP injection. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to bypass username verification.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-56841

The W3 Total Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the is_w3tc_admin_page function in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.1. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to obtain the plugin's nonce value and perform unauthorized actions, resulting in information disclosure, ser

An improper privilege management vulnerability in the web management interface of the Zyxel WBE530 firmware versions through 7.00(ACLE.3) andÂ WBE660S firmware versions through 6.70(ACGG.2) could allow an authenticated user with limited privileges to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator, enabling them to upload configuration files to a vulnerable device.

CVE-2024-12398 (8.8 high) An improper privilege management vulnerability in the web management interface of the Zyxel WBE530 firmware versions through 7.00(ACLE.3) and WBE660S firmware versions through 6.70(ACGG.2) could allow an authenticated user with limited privileges to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator, enabling them to upload configuration files to a vulnerable device.

CVE-2025-0070
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T03:31:48

3 posts

SAP NetWeaver Application Server for ABAP and ABAP Platform allows an authenticated attacker to obtain illegitimate access to the system by exploiting improper authentication checks, resulting in privilege escalation. On successful exploitation, this can result in potential security concerns. This results in a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T01:57:51.000Z ##

Looks like Patch Tuesday started for SAP. Here are a couple sev:HIGH and a couple sev:CRIT CVEs for those interested:

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0061

SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform session hijacking over the network without any user interaction, due to an information disclosure vulnerability. Attacker can access and modify all the data of the application.

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0063

SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP and ABAP Platform does not check for authorization when a user executes some RFC function modules. This could lead to an attacker with basic user privileges to gain control over the data in Informix database, leading to complete compromise of confidentiality, integrity and availability.

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0066

Under certain conditions SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP and ABAP Platform (Internet Communication Framework) allows an attacker to access restricted information due to weak access controls. This can have a significant impact on the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an application

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0070

SAP NetWeaver Application Server for ABAP and ABAP Platform allows an authenticated attacker to obtain illegitimate access to the system by exploiting improper authentication checks, resulting in privilege escalation. On successful exploitation, this can result in potential security concerns. This results in a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

I don't have any more details without a login and I'm on mobile and, most importantly, I don't care enough to log on until tomorrow. Good luck and Happy Patch Tuesday. ð»

#patchTuesday

SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform session hijacking over the network without any user interaction, due to an information disclosure vulnerability. Attacker can access and modify all the data of the application.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T01:57:51.000Z ##

Looks like Patch Tuesday started for SAP. Here are a couple sev:HIGH and a couple sev:CRIT CVEs for those interested:

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0061

SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform session hijacking over the network without any user interaction, due to an information disclosure vulnerability. Attacker can access and modify all the data of the application.

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0063

SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP and ABAP Platform does not check for authorization when a user executes some RFC function modules. This could lead to an attacker with basic user privileges to gain control over the data in Informix database, leading to complete compromise of confidentiality, integrity and availability.

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0066

Under certain conditions SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP and ABAP Platform (Internet Communication Framework) allows an attacker to access restricted information due to weak access controls. This can have a significant impact on the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an application

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0070

SAP NetWeaver Application Server for ABAP and ABAP Platform allows an authenticated attacker to obtain illegitimate access to the system by exploiting improper authentication checks, resulting in privilege escalation. On successful exploitation, this can result in potential security concerns. This results in a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

I don't have any more details without a login and I'm on mobile and, most importantly, I don't care enough to log on until tomorrow. Good luck and Happy Patch Tuesday. ð»

#patchTuesday

##

CVE-2024-52935
(4.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T21:31:55

1 posts

Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest's virtualised GPU memory.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T15:02:11.000Z ##

There we go, reader mode, FTW.

CVE-2024-52938: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to subvert reconstruction activities to trigger a write of data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52937: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52936: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52935: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47895: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47894: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47897: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls resulting in platform instability and reboots.

CVE-2024-46973: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

CVE-2024-43703: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to achieve unauthorised reads and writes of physical memory from the GPU HW.

CVE-2024-43702: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

CVE-2024-43705: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user can trigger the GPU kernel driver to write to arbitrary read-only system files that have been mapped into application memory.

##

CVE-2025-22134
(4.2 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T21:15:14.333000

1 posts

When switching to other buffers using the :all command and visual mode still being active, this may cause a heap-buffer overflow, because Vim does not properly end visual mode and therefore may try to access beyond the end of a line in a buffer. In Patch 9.1.1003 Vim will correctly reset the visual mode before opening other windows and buffers and therefore fix this bug. In addition it does verify

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T20:50:00.000Z ##

Hey vim nerds, enjoy your overflow: https://github.com/vim/vim/security/advisories/GHSA-5rgf-26wj-48v8

CVE-2025-22134

CVE-2025-23108
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T18:33:02

1 posts

Opening Javascript links in a new tab via long-press in the Firefox iOS client could result in a malicious script spoofing the URL of the new tab. This vulnerability affects Firefox for iOS < 134.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-11T15:18:18.000Z ##

Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2025-06 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox for iOS 134
Mozilla has the audacity to drop a security advisory early Saturday morning and call it Friday night's release. They get a pass this time because they're headquartered in San Francisco CA (GMT-8 or Pacific time zone) and their state is on fire. Two CVEs patched:

  • CVE-2025-23108 (moderate) Firefox Mobile iOS Full Address Bar Spoof Using Open in New Tab and Javascript URI
  • CVE-2025-23109 (moderate) Address bar spoofing on iOS using long hostnames

No mention of exploitation

#mozilla #firefox #ios #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:44:22.000Z ##

I like me some critical RCE in Internet connected shit, especially when it's from companies like ABB, but something seems odd to me on this one so I hope I'm just reading it wrong.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-5743

An attacker could exploit the 'Use of Password Hash With Insufficient Computational Effort' vulnerability in EveHome Eve Play to execute arbitrary code. This issue affects Eve Play: through 1.1.42.

sev:CRIT 9.8 CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

So it's RCE because of a bad password hash? And it's AV:N? It seems like there's a step missing in there, doesn't it? Like a disclosure bug or something?

updated 2025-01-12T21:30:21

GNU Chess 6.2.7 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted PGN (Portable Game Notation) data. This is related to a buffer overflow in the use of a .tmp.epd temporary file in the cmd_pgnload and cmd_pgnreplay functions in frontend/cmd.cc.

CVE-2025-0397
(3.5 LOW)

CVE-2024-12847
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2025-01-10T21:31:33

5 posts

NETGEAR DGN1000 before 1.1.00.48 is vulnerable to an authentication bypass vulnerability. A remote and unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary operating system commands as root by sending crafted HTTP requests to the setup.cgi endpoint. This vulnerability has been exploited in the wild since at least 2017.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-15T15:13:29.176Z ##

SANS ISC: The Curious Case of a 12-Year-Old Netgear Router Vulnerability
A log caught a weaponized exploit for CVE-2024-12847 (9.8 critical) NETGEAR DGN1000 authentication bypass vulnerability, which raises more questions than provides answers: the vulnerability was first discovered in May 2013, and the 16 year old router is not probably powerful enough for cryptomining. Indicators of compromise provided.

#CVE_2024_12847 #netgear #vulnerability #cryptomining #ioc #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity

(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T21:32:34

1 posts

A post-authentication absolute path traversal vulnerability in SonicOS management allows a remote attacker to read an arbitrary file.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

CVE-2025-21598
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-09T21:31:40

1 posts

AnÂ Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved's routing protocol daemon (rpd) allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to sendÂ malformed BGP packets to a device configured with packet receive trace options enabled to crash rpd. This issue affects: Junos OS:Â  * from 21.2R3-S8 before 21.2R3-S9,Â  * from 21.4R3-S7 before 21.4R3-S9,Â  * from

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-10T17:03:30.000Z ##

Juniper security advisory 08 January 2025: 2025-01 Security Bulletin: Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved: When BGP traceoptions are configured, receipt of malformed BGP packets causes RPD to crash (CVE-2025-21598)
CVE-2025-21598 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5, v4.0: 8.2 high) An Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved's routing protocol daemon (rpd) allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to send malformed BGP packets to a device configured with packet receive trace options enabled to crash rpd.
Multiple requirements are listed in the advisory for exposure to this vulnerability. Disabling packet tracing options will work around this issue.

Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

#juniper #junos #CVE_2025_21598 #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-12802
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:15:14.683000

1 posts

SSL-VPN MFA Bypass in SonicWALL SSL-VPN can arise in specific cases due to the separate handling of UPN (User Principal Name) and SAM (Security Account Manager) account names when integrated with Microsoft Active Directory, allowing MFA to be configured independently for each login method and potentially enabling attackers to bypass MFA by exploiting the alternative account name.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-12542
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-09T12:31:01

1 posts

The linkID plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check when including the 'phpinfo' function in all versions up to, and including, 0.1.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to read configuration settings and predefined variables on the site's server. The plugin does not need to be activated for the vulnerability to be exploi

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-07T21:31:59

2 posts

Multiple command injection vulnerabilities exist in the web interface of the 501 Wireless Client Bridge which could lead to authenticated remote command execution. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability of an attacker to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system. Exploitation requires administrative authentication credentials

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-07T05:15:16.660000

1 posts

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to overwrite the seo-beginner-auto-post.php file which can be leveraged to achieve remote code execution.

CVE-2024-46973
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-28T18:31:50

1 posts

Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T15:02:11.000Z ##

There we go, reader mode, FTW.

CVE-2024-52938: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to subvert reconstruction activities to trigger a write of data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52937: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52936: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52935: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47895: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47894: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47897: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls resulting in platform instability and reboots.

CVE-2024-46973: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

CVE-2024-43703: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to achieve unauthorised reads and writes of physical memory from the GPU HW.

CVE-2024-43702: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

CVE-2024-43705: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user can trigger the GPU kernel driver to write to arbitrary read-only system files that have been mapped into application memory.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T17:19:49.000Z ##

Microsoft: Analyzing CVE-2024-44243, a macOS System Integrity Protection bypass through kernel extensions
CVE-2024-44243 (CISA CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) security feature bypass. Microsoft describes it as a macOS vulnerability that could allow attackers to bypass Apple's System Integrity Protection (SIP) in macOS by loading third party kernel extensions. SIP is a security technology that restricts the performance of operations that may compromise system integrity. The bypass of SIP could increase the potential for attackers and malware authors to successfully install rootkits, create persistent malware, bypass Transparency, Consent and Control (TCC), and expand the attack surface for additional techniques and exploits. Microsoft provides a root cause analysis of CVE-2024-44243.

#CVE_2024_44243 #SIP #Apple #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #tcc

##

CVE-2024-12686
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 6.18%

updated 2024-12-18T21:31:03

4 posts

A vulnerability has been discovered in Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) which can allow an attacker with existing administrative privileges to inject commands and run as a site user.

nikolozk at 2025-01-14T14:02:25.725Z ##

ðð²ðð¼ð»ð±ð§ð¿ððð ðð£ð ðð²ð ðð¼ðºð½ð¿ð¼ðºð¶ðð² ðð»ð®ð¯ð¹ð²ð ð§ð¿ð²ð®ððð¿ð ð¦ðððð²ðº ðð°ð°ð²ðð

State-sponsored threat actors have exploited a stolen BeyondTrust API key to breach U.S. Treasury systems, accessing unclassified workstations and documents.

â£ Impact Scope:
- Treasury Department workstations
- Organizations using BeyondTrust Remote Support SaaS
- Federal systems with similar configurations

â£ Current Status:
- BeyondTrust service taken offline
- API key revoked
- Two critical vulnerabilities identified (CVE-2024-12356, CVE-2024-12686)

â£ Immediate Actions Required:
- Audit API key access and rotation policies
- Review remote support tool configurations
- Monitor for unauthorized access attempts
- Apply available patches immediately

The compromise is yet another demonstration of how a single API key can bypass multiple security layers.

Is your organization regularly auditing and rotating API keys across cloud services?

You can also join cybersecurity leaders and professionals who receive these insights in my weekly newsletter

Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2023-48365 (NVD: 9.9 critical) Qlik Sense HTTP Tunneling Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-12686 (6.6 medium) BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) OS Command Injection Vulnerability

verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2025-01-10T23:05:00.000Z ##

CVE-2024-49113 / 7.5 HIGH

âLDAP Nightmareâ, attackers have devised a cunning new strategy to exploit the buzz around this vulnerability. Trend Micro has uncovered malicious repositories masquerading as proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits for the critical Windows vulnerability. These fake PoCs specifically target security researchers, red teamers, and SOC teams, delivering information-stealing malware instead of legitimate testing tools.

IoCs below in the found post:

CVE-2024-53900
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T16:41:02

1 posts

Mongoose versions prior to 8.8.3, 7.8.3, and 6.13.5 are vulnerable to improper use of the $where operator. This vulnerability arises from the ability of the $where clause to execute arbitrary JavaScript code in MongoDB queries, potentially leading to code injection attacks and unauthorized access or manipulation of database data.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T07:09:27.000Z ##

CVE-2025-23061 â Mongoose Search Injection Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-23061 Published : Jan. 15, 2025, 5:15 a.m. | 1 hour, 53 minutes ago Description : Mongoose before 8.9.5 can improperly use a nested $where filter with a populate() match, leading to search injection. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2024-53900. Severity: 9.0 | CRITICAL Visit the link for more details, such as CVSS details, affected products, timeline, and more... CVE-2024-43702
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-02T00:35:08

1 posts

Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T15:02:11.000Z ##

There we go, reader mode, FTW.

CVE-2024-52938: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to subvert reconstruction activities to trigger a write of data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52937: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52936: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52935: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47895: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47894: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guestâs virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47897: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls resulting in platform instability and reboots.

CVE-2024-46973: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

CVE-2024-43703: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to achieve unauthorised reads and writes of physical memory from the GPU HW.

CVE-2024-43702: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

CVE-2024-43705: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user can trigger the GPU kernel driver to write to arbitrary read-only system files that have been mapped into application memory.

CVE-2024-47897: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls resulting in platform instability and reboots.

CVE-2024-46973: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

CVE-2024-43703: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to achieve unauthorised reads and writes of physical memory from the GPU HW.

CVE-2024-43702: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

CVE-2024-43705: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user can trigger the GPU kernel driver to write to arbitrary read-only system files that have been mapped into application memory.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T15:33:12.048Z ##

@decio vendor Fortinet put out a blog post https://www.fortinet.com/blog/psirt-blogs/analysis-of-threat-actor-data-posting that corrobates @GossiTheDog's assessment.

They also concluded that CVE-2018-13379 (9.8 critical) FortiOS SSL VPN Path Traversal Vulnerability was exploited too.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T03:19:01.068Z ##

Fortinet: Analysis of Threat Actor Data Posting
Best hearing it from the vendor themselves when it comes to attributing a vulnerability in their own product: Fortinet corroborates @GossiTheDog's assessment (see parent toots above) that CVE-2022-40684 (9.8 critical) Fortinet Authentication Bypass Vulnerability was leveraged in order to obtain the stolen data. They also found evidence of CVE-2018-13379 (9.8 critical) FortiOS SSL VPN Path Traversal Vulnerability exploitation based on the data in password.txt.

  • The threat actor has leaked data obtained in dated campaigns that has been aggregated to appear like a new disclosure. Our analysis of the devices in question show that the majority have long since upgraded to newer versions.
  • We can also confirm that devices purchased since December 2022 or devices which have only run FortiOS 7.2.2 or above are not impacted by the information disclosed by this threat actor.
  • Whilst this data is several years old and the IP addresses have been observed to no longer be relevant in many cases, we will be reaching out to any customers, where identified, to recommend to review configurations.

#fortinet #fortigate #fortios #vulnerability #CVE_2018_13379 #CVE_2022_40684 #BelsenGroup #cybercrime #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #CVE #eitw

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-16T00:26:08.000Z ##

The other thing to mention is the prior dump was via CVE-2018-13379. These devices, based on the config dumps, are largely running versions which were long ago patched for that.

So what = later vuln.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T15:33:12.000Z ##

@decio vendor Fortinet put out a blog post https://www.fortinet.com/blog/psirt-blogs/analysis-of-threat-actor-data-posting that corrobates @GossiTheDog's assessment.

They also concluded that CVE-2018-13379 (9.8 critical) FortiOS SSL VPN Path Traversal Vulnerability was exploited too.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T03:19:01.000Z ##

Fortinet: Analysis of Threat Actor Data Posting
Best hearing it from the vendor themselves when it comes to attributing a vulnerability in their own product: Fortinet corroborates @GossiTheDog's assessment (see parent toots above) that CVE-2022-40684 (9.8 critical) Fortinet Authentication Bypass Vulnerability was leveraged in order to obtain the stolen data. They also found evidence of CVE-2018-13379 (9.8 critical) FortiOS SSL VPN Path Traversal Vulnerability exploitation based on the data in password.txt.

  • The threat actor has leaked data obtained in dated campaigns that has been aggregated to appear like a new disclosure. Our analysis of the devices in question show that the majority have long since upgraded to newer versions.
  • We can also confirm that devices purchased since December 2022 or devices which have only run FortiOS 7.2.2 or above are not impacted by the information disclosed by this threat actor.
  • Whilst this data is several years old and the IP addresses have been observed to no longer be relevant in many cases, we will be reaching out to any customers, where identified, to recommend to review configurations.

#fortinet #fortigate #fortios #vulnerability #CVE_2018_13379 #CVE_2022_40684 #BelsenGroup #cybercrime #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #CVE #eitw

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-16T00:26:08.000Z ##

The other thing to mention is the prior dump was via CVE-2018-13379. These devices, based on the config dumps, are largely running versions which were long ago patched for that.

So what = later vuln.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon

##

CVE-2023-48365
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.66%

updated 2023-12-08T05:05:23

3 posts

Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows before August 2023 Patch 2 allows unauthenticated remote code execution, aka QB-21683. Due to improper validation of HTTP headers, a remote attacker is able to elevate their privilege by tunneling HTTP requests, allowing them to execute HTTP requests on the backend server that hosts the repository application. The fixed versions are August 2023 Patch 2, May 2023 P

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2025-01-13T16:06:01.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2023-48365
Vendor: Qlik
Product: Sense
Date Added: 2025-01-13
Vulnerability: Qlik Sense HTTP Tunneling Vulnerability
Notes: https://community.qlik.com/t5/Official-Support-Articles/Critical-Security-fixes-for-Qlik-Sense-Enterprise-for-Windows/tac-p/2120510 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-48365
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-48365

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T15:26:33.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2023-48365 (NVD: 9.9 critical) Qlik Sense HTTP Tunneling Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-12686 (6.6 medium) BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) OS Command Injection Vulnerability

See previous toot for Qlik exploitation evidence. BeyondTrust didn't identify CVE-2024-12686 being exploited in the wild in their security advisory.

##

CVE-2023-38041
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-11-09T05:04:07

1 posts

A logged in user may elevate its permissions by abusing a Time-of-Check to Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) race condition. When a particular process flow is initiated, an attacker can exploit this condition to gain unauthorized elevated privileges on the affected system.

1 repos

https://github.com/ewilded/CVE-2023-38041-POC

fre at 2025-01-15T16:11:32.772Z ##

Honestly can't say I am too surprised that #Ivanti stuff is making the rounds again.

The first 'impactful' vulnerability I ever found was an LPE in their Connect Secure Client, and disclosure was an absolute mess. We (attempted to) disclose a LPE in July of 2022, sent reminder / follow-ups every few weeks to months, only for it to be released in October 2023 with another research credited.. After reaching out, turns out they forgot about our disclosure, even though we sent periodic reminders lmfao

Suffice it to say, that quickly taught me to be very skeptical of "responsible disclosure" with these kinds of companies, and painted a pretty clear picture of the security landscape at Ivanti

##

CVE-2022-40684
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.28%

updated 2023-03-27T18:30:24

12 posts

An authentication bypass using an alternate path or channel [CWE-288] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.6, FortiProxy version 7.2.0 and version 7.0.0 through 7.0.6 and FortiSwitchManager version 7.2.0 and 7.0.0 allows an unauthenticated atttacker to perform operations on the administrative interface via specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-17T03:19:01.068Z ##

Fortinet: Analysis of Threat Actor Data Posting
Best hearing it from the vendor themselves when it comes to attributing a vulnerability in their own product: Fortinet corroborates @GossiTheDog's assessment (see parent toots above) that CVE-2022-40684 (9.8 critical) Fortinet Authentication Bypass Vulnerability was leveraged in order to obtain the stolen data. They also found evidence of CVE-2018-13379 (9.8 critical) FortiOS SSL VPN Path Traversal Vulnerability exploitation based on the data in password.txt.

  • The threat actor has leaked data obtained in dated campaigns that has been aggregated to appear like a new disclosure. Our analysis of the devices in question show that the majority have long since upgraded to newer versions.
  • We can also confirm that devices purchased since December 2022 or devices which have only run FortiOS 7.2.2 or above are not impacted by the information disclosed by this threat actor.
  • Whilst this data is several years old and the IP addresses have been observed to no longer be relevant in many cases, we will be reaching out to any customers, where identified, to recommend to review configurations.

#fortinet #fortigate #fortios #vulnerability #CVE_2018_13379 #CVE_2022_40684 #BelsenGroup #cybercrime #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #CVE #eitw

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-16T14:24:20.231Z ##

Double Pulsar: 2022 zero day was used to raid Fortigate firewall configs. Somebody just released them.
FortiGate firewall logs stolen during a mass exploitation of CVE-2022-40684 years ago appears to have been publicly released yesterday by a new threat actor called Belsen Group. @GossiTheDog verified the authenticity of the data for at least one victim organization and dated the logs and exploitation timeframe to October 2022. See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Hackers leak configs and VPN credentials for 15,000 FortiGate devices

#threatintel #CVE_2022_40684 #fortinet #fortigate #vulnerability #eitw #BelsenGroup #cybercrime #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T03:19:01.000Z ##

Fortinet: Analysis of Threat Actor Data Posting
Best hearing it from the vendor themselves when it comes to attributing a vulnerability in their own product: Fortinet corroborates @GossiTheDog's assessment (see parent toots above) that CVE-2022-40684 (9.8 critical) Fortinet Authentication Bypass Vulnerability was leveraged in order to obtain the stolen data. They also found evidence of CVE-2018-13379 (9.8 critical) FortiOS SSL VPN Path Traversal Vulnerability exploitation based on the data in password.txt.

  • The threat actor has leaked data obtained in dated campaigns that has been aggregated to appear like a new disclosure. Our analysis of the devices in question show that the majority have long since upgraded to newer versions.
  • We can also confirm that devices purchased since December 2022 or devices which have only run FortiOS 7.2.2 or above are not impacted by the information disclosed by this threat actor.
  • Whilst this data is several years old and the IP addresses have been observed to no longer be relevant in many cases, we will be reaching out to any customers, where identified, to recommend to review configurations.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Hackers leak configs and VPN credentials for 15,000 FortiGate devices

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-16T01:05:00.000Z ##

One final update - did some IR on an impacted device, it looks like CVE-2022-40684 based on artefacts left behind.

It also looks like the data was assembled in October 2022 and only just released, looking back at historic IP records vs the dump. So basically if your config might be in the dump even if you patched, as it was a zero day at the time.

Also in the dump is complete firewall rules for the devices.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-16T01:05:00.000Z ##

One final update - did some IR on an impacted device, it looks like CVE-2022-40684 based on artefacts left behind.

It also looks like the data was assembled in October 2022 and only just released, looking back at historic IP records vs the dump. So basically if your config might be in the dump even if you patched, as it was a zero day at the time.

Also in the dump is complete firewall rules for the devices.

CVE-2025-23039
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2025-01-17T21:25:26.755Z ##

LOL. LMAO.

https://github.com/caido/caido/security/advisories/GHSA-3mfw-fhfp-mgrv

Caido is a web security auditing toolkit. A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability was identified in Caido v0.45.0 due to improper sanitization in the URL decoding tooltip of HTTP request and response editors. This issue could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary scripts, potentially leading to the theft of sensitive information. This issue has been addressed in version 0.45.1 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23039

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-17T21:25:26.000Z ##

LOL. LMAO.

https://github.com/caido/caido/security/advisories/GHSA-3mfw-fhfp-mgrv

Caido is a web security auditing toolkit. A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability was identified in Caido v0.45.0 due to improper sanitization in the URL decoding tooltip of HTTP request and response editors. This issue could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary scripts, potentially leading to the theft of sensitive information. This issue has been addressed in version 0.45.1 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23039

##

CVE-2025-23202
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2025-01-17T21:17:52.358Z ##

It's too bad Sanitize Thy Inputs didn't make the top ten, otherwise this perfect 10.0 ð¥³ could have been prevented:

https://github.com/devycreates/Bible-Module/security/advisories/GHSA-cm7w-99v2-prrq

Bible Module is a tool designed for ROBLOX developers to integrate Bible functionality into their games. The FetchVerse and FetchPassage functions in the Bible Module are susceptible to injection attacks due to the absence of input validation. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to manipulate the API request URLs, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data tampering. This issue has been addressed in version 0.0.3. All users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23202

CVE-2025-0147: Zoom Fixes High-Severity Security Flaw

CVE-2025-0147: Zoom Fixes High-Severity Security Flaw Zoom has released six security bulletin addressing several vulnerabilities across its product ecosystem, ranging in severity from low to high. These vulnerabilities affect various platforms, including ... Read more Published Date: Jan 15, 2025 (4 hours, 53 minutes [â¦]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2025-0147-zoom-fixes-high-severity-security-flaw/3693/

##

CVE-2024-52005
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2025-01-15T18:31:31.808Z ##

Git sounding a bit snarky in CVE-2024-52005

When cloning from a server (or fetching, or pushing), informational or error messages are transported from the remote Git process to the client via the so-called "sideband channel". These messages will be prefixed with "remote:" and printed directly to the standard error output.

Typically, this standard error output is connected to a terminal that understands ANSI escape sequences, which Git did not protect against. Most modern terminals support control sequences that can be used by a malicious actor to hide and misrepresent information, or to mislead the user into executing untrusted scripts.

https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-7jjc-gg6m-3329

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-15T18:31:31.000Z ##

Git sounding a bit snarky in CVE-2024-52005

When cloning from a server (or fetching, or pushing), informational or error messages are transported from the remote Git process to the client via the so-called "sideband channel". These messages will be prefixed with "remote:" and printed directly to the standard error output.

Typically, this standard error output is connected to a terminal that understands ANSI escape sequences, which Git did not protect against. Most modern terminals support control sequences that can be used by a malicious actor to hide and misrepresent information, or to mislead the user into executing untrusted scripts.

https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-7jjc-gg6m-3329

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-15T07:09:26.000Z ##

CVE-2024-54142 â âDiscourse AI HTML Entity Leaking Vulnerabilityâ

CVE ID : CVE-2024-54142 Published : Jan. 14, 2025, 11:15 p.m. | 7 hours, 53 minutes ago Description : Discourse AI is a Discourse plugin which provides a number of AI features. When sharing Discourse AI Bot conversations into posts, if the conversation had HTML entities those could leak into the Discourse application when a user visited a post with a onebox to said conversation. This issue has been addressed in commit `92f122c`. Users are advised to update. Users unable to update may [â¦]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2024-54142-discourse-ai-html-entity-leaking-vulnerability/3729/

CVE-2022-23439
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy

  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command

  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
